thread.title: Rinne gets shutout in 2-0 Preds win over Oilers
thread.title_full: Rinne gets shutout in 2-0 Preds win over Oilers

title: Rinne gets shutout in 2-0 Preds win over Oilers
text:
Rinne gets shutout in 2-0 Preds win over Oilers 
Updated: Sat, Oct 10 2015, 11:49 PM 
NASHVILLE, Tenn. -- Pekka Rinne made 31 saves to help the Nashville Predators beat the Edmonton Oilers 2-0 on Saturday night.Craig Smith and Filip Forsberg scored for Nashville, which also won its season opener against Carolina on Thursday. It was Rinne's 37th career shutout.Edmonton's Connor McDavid, the No. 1 overall pick in the June draft, played 18 1/2 minutes and had two shots on goal. He struggled again on faceoffs, winning only two of 11. On Thursday night in his NHL debut, won three of 13 faceoff in a loss at St. Louis.
